page.title: 03MALVERN HILLS CONSERVATORS
page.content: The {Conservators}are a group of voluntary people who preserve the hills.They have to keep the hills clear of litter,the benches in good condition and they mow{100 miles}of pathway twice a year.The{Conservators} are a body of 29 elected or nominated members,a part time accountant and clerk and 9 full time workers- a { {Ranger} and 8 workmen. They are the oldest{Conservation} group in the country.Formed in{1884 {by an Act of Parliament,}their duties are protect the hills' natural beauty, keep them 'open' for the public and to prevent encroachment and erosion. They spend{Â£l30,000}which they get from the rates and they own{3,000 acres of common land and the hills. Half of this is common land and the {Conservators}must protect the commoners rights.
